page.title: 11THE CEMETERY IN GREENFORD
page.content: We went to the Greenford Cemetery. There were many tombs which were about 6-10 feet deep. There are two people buried in each plot. As I walked behind the rest I noticed a tomb stone for a baby which had died three days old without a name. As I walked round the corner there were a lot of bouquets saying,'Nan and Mum,' in forget-me-nots. We went past the Moslem plot. Last time I went there some people were praying and had red smoke going up into the air. When people are buried, their heads point towards Mecca. There were two men rolling a grave stone. I think they were going to put another body in the grave. They were using a steel pole to shift the stone.
